title: Power cuts continue in Sri Lanka with 3 hrs 45 min outages scheduled for March 19
body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s utility provider the Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) said power cuts of three hours and 45 minutes will be imposed in multiple areas on Saturday (19) while a three-hour power cuts will be imposed in the rest of the island.
A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, and L areas in the power cut schedule will lose power for 2.5 hours between 8am and 6pm and for one hour and 15 minutes between 6pm and 11pm on Saturday.
Meanwhile, P, Q, R, S, T, U, V, and W areas will have a 2-hour power cut between 10am and 4pm and another 1.5-hour outage between 4pm and 10pm.

The Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) has limited the power shedding to 4 hours per day from the previous seven-hour power cut earlier this month after the Ceylon Petroleum Corporation (CPC) agreed to provide fuel sufficient for thermal power generation.
With the ongoing forex crisis, Sri Lanka government is struggling to secure gas, medicine and other essential imports along with fuel. (Colombo/Ma18/2022)
